questions.question: Lamar Valley is known as the #1 spot for viewing which animal?
In 1885, Geologist Arnold Hague named the river after a man employed in which field?
questions.info: The river was named for L.Q.C. (Lucius Quinctius Cincinnatus) Lamar, then Secretary of the Interior (March 1885 â€“ January 1888)

questions.question: In 2013, the National Park Service required mandatory killing of which fish caught when in the Lamar River drainage?
questions.info: The mandatory killing of rainbow and brook trout caught in the Lamar River drainage is intended to protect native cutthroat trout.

questions.question: How long is the road between Tower Junction and the Northeast Entrance?
questions.info: The road along the Lamar Valley is the only road open year-long.
